profileText: A Representative from Connecticut; born in Waterbury, New Haven County, Conn., December 23, 1911; attended Driggs, St. Mary's and Crosby high schools in Waterbury; graduated from Dartmouth College in 1933 and from Harvard Law School in 1937; was admitted to the Connecticut bar in 1938 and commenced the practice of law in Waterbury, Conn., the same year; president of the Waterbury Board of Aldermen 1940-1943; mayor of Waterbury 1943-1948; member of the board of directors of Waterbury Savings Bank; delegate, Democratic National Conventions, 1944, 1948, 1960, 1964, and 1968; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1959-January 3, 1973); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Ninety-third Congress in 1972; resumed the practice of law; died on October 23, 2005, in Washington, D.C.

researchRecord.description: The congressional papers of John Stephen Monagan contain copies of correspondence, press releases, statements and speeches, legislation, television tapes and films. A finding aid is available in the library and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Breen-Monagan Collection, 1948-1970, 0.5 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: The collection contains correspondence between Dan Breen and the Honorable John Monagan, former U.S. Congressman from Connecticut, during the years 1948 to 1969. The collection offers insight into the thoughts of an early twentieth-century freedom fighter towards the political issues and events which confronted a rapidly changing and increasingly violent world in this postwar period. A finding aid is available in the library and online.

researchRecord.name: In the John Monagan-Anthony Powell Collection, 1969-1994, 7 boxes.
researchRecord.description: The papers document John Monagan's correspondence with the writer, Anthony Powell. In addition to the letters, John Monagan has also collected various magazine and newspaper articles relating to Anthony Powell. A highlight of the collection is the group of 46 photographs of Anthony and Violet Powell at their home, the Chantry in Somerset, England. Most of the photographs were taken by John Monagan during visits made with his wife, Rosemary, in 1981, 1987 and 1988.

researchRecord.name: 1945-1985. 2 boxes.
researchRecord.description: Material relating to his research and publication on Oliver Wendell Holmes. Includes oral history interviews on Holmes.

researchRecord.name: John S. Monagan Papers Regarding Naum Gabo, 1969-1982, 0.2 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: The papers document the friendship of John S. Monagan with the artist, Naum Gabo. The papers include correspondence, notes taken as a result of meetings, newspaper clippings, and photographs.
